content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: TAETORD
      operator: exists
    - name: SVSTDTC
      operator: date_greater_than_or_equal_to
      value: SESTDTC
    - name: SVSTDTC
      operator: date_less_than_or_equal_to
      value: SEENDTC
    - name: TAETORD
      operator: not_equal_to
      value: SE.TAETORD
Match Datasets:
  - Name: SE
    Keys:
      - USUBJID
Core:
  Id: CDISC.SDTMIG.CG0217
  Version: '1'
  Status: Draft
Description: Raise an error when variable TAETORD values don't match between Subject
  Visits (SV) and Subject Elements (SE) datasets.
Outcome:
  Message: TAETORD values don't match between Subject Visits (SV) and Subject Elements
    (SE) datasets.
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0217
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: If TAETORD and/or EPOCH are added, then the values
                  must be those at the start of the visit.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 11
                Section: '5.5'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - SV

json.Description: Raise an error when variable TAETORD values don't match between Subject Visits (SV) and Subject Elements (SE) datasets.

Outcome.Message: TAETORD values don't match between Subject Visits (SV) and Subject Elements (SE) datasets.

Citations.Cited_Guidance: If TAETORD and/or EPOCH are added, then the values must be those at the start of the visit.
